description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission Wheelie 45L Rolling Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mission Wheelie 45L Rolling Gear Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission Wheelie 45L Rolling Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this travel bag because I needed something quick to replace my Mission Wheelie 130 which was in for repairs from heavy damage by the baggage folks of American Airlines. I travel a lot for the U.S. Forest Service for incident management, and have found this Mission 65 to be a great travel bag for short trips with the same features as the larger 130 version. Very pleased with the weight, mobility and updated materials used on this new version.
review.name: Mission Wheelie 65

review.reviewBody: I appreciate the additional pockets and zippers which allow better organization. Even though I find shoe storage silly as it makes it so much harder to pack around the shoes, it's nice to have as an option. Handle and wheels are sturdy which is great. Everything else is worse: The new fabric is not as sturdy, already seeing significant degradation after three airline trips with never more than one plane switch over. The ID pocket is so poorly placed and designed I doubt your card will survive more than two consecutive flights. But the real issue is the sizing. I don't know who is in charge over there but I'm exhausted by MR making objectively poor decisions while also lazily designing products. I regularly see 65l packs as carry-ons and these guys think that's all of a sudden a good check in size? Filled with clothes, the 65l weighs 35 pounds. Everyone who has ever traveled anywhere knows that the ideal size for a checked bag is 90 liters. The old 80l was ok and I hoped they would increase capacity to 90 but here we are at 65. 110l is almost always too heavy which means the whole series is practically worthless for air travel. I would recommend it for vehicular travel but I imagine that few people are shopping for that purpose.
review.name: It's mostly better

review.reviewBody: Bought this as my bag for week-long cross-state bicycle ride. First use was slung under the shuttle bus to beginning town then bag was collected every morning & transported to next night's hotel.  Held more than enough clothes, bike gear, shoes for the week. On  last day had water bottles, empty panniers, everything I didn't want to carry was stuffed into it and slung under the bus. No damage, no loose ends, no problems at all. Bottom hard shell protects CPAP case well when padded with clothes.
review.name: Robust, easy to handle, protected CPAP etc.

review.reviewBody: Great roller suitcase for all my travel needs.  Many pockets for organization!
review.name: Awesome roller!

review.reviewBody: this is the MR version of a stoable airline travel bag.  I like that the upper half is soft so you can smash it in when on an overloaded flight.  the wheels look bomb proof.  has a handle everywhere.  Will be buying another one size up soon.
review.name: tougher than the rest

review.reviewBody:
I'm a long-time MR customer and advocate. I love their products and pack innovations. They always think of everything when it comes to how they develop products. However, in this instance (45L Mission Wheelie), they have fallen just short. The issue is getting the bag in and out of overhead carry-on spaces on some models of planes, including Delta's smaller domestic jets. 

The online measurements state it is 12", but the bag I received is 12.5" (at the wheels). Yes, this is a duffle style and can be "smooshed." However, if the internal braces are engaged, it is quite rigid and too wide to fit through the opening of the overheads. Let's be frank, you aren't going to wheel this around an airport without the braces engaged because it would stand on its own and it is not feasible to disengage the braces before boarding.

All other aspects exceed my expectations -They are up to MR's standard. But I needed a carry-on for domestic travel, and now I am checking this thing at the gate on each flight -- therefore, rendering it useless for my needs.
review.name: 45L - Says TSA approved, but doesn't fit Delta

review.reviewBody: Love everything about this pack, the size, the breakdown, the wheeling/handling. The thing I miss is locking function. I also got the mission 45 and there is locking function on the zippers which I love and thought was offered on the larger. Overall though very satisfied. Traveling to Nepal in a few weeks for a trip to Everest so check back after I truly get some miles on this product.
review.name: Bomb proof with tons of space!

review.reviewBody: I am sailing in Croatia so i needed a soft side luggage for storage on the boat. This is perfect for carrying all my stuff and stores well when not in use.  The bottom is secure and crush proof.
review.name: This is a beast of suitcase

review.reviewBody: Ight be bomb proof, but is not United Airlines proof. They managed to tear a hole in my 80l., on the first flight. Other than that, I love it.
review.name: Bomb proof?

review.reviewBody: This bag has been an awesome upgrade. Internal compartments are well thought out. There is a dirty clothes area as well as a shoe pocket and other compartments to keep things tidy. Looks great and is easy to pack around. I have been able to fit a weeks worth of work clothes in the bag, plus extra travel gear and had no problems. Materials seem to be solid as well. I look forward to using this bag for years to come.
review.name: Great Bag!

name: Mission Wheelie 45L Rolling Gear Bag

review.reviewBody: The Cloudshield Rain Jacket is an awesome jacket. It is built with great quality throughout, and the overall feel is very nice. It will definitely be one of my favorites on many days even without rain.Only improvement I'd recommend would be to add additional exterior or interior chest pocket(s) for things like earbuds, keys, etc.
review.name: Great rain jacket!

review.reviewBody: One of the best fitting rain jackets Iâ€™ve ever worn. The cut is great, it stretches and feels amazing. Color is great as well. Canâ€™t say more about how great this jacket looks and fits. Unfortunately, quite possibly the worst rain outer Iâ€™ve ever used. Impressive how little water this thing repels. Iâ€™ve used twr jackets for years and have always been disappointed. I was excited to try a real waterproof membrane based jacket. Wore this jacket in light rain for 2.5 hours and was completely soaking wet. Left it hanging for a day and it was still wet.I would buy this jacket in a heartbeat for the fit and look. But unfortunately canâ€™t recommend for rain.
review.name: Great jacket, not waterproof thi

review.reviewBody: We live in Fort Lauderdale and I wanted to get my husband a light weight rain jacket for all of our tropical storms. It is light weight, doesn't make scratchy noise, high quality fabric, and a slim fit. He is 6'8 225lbs and normally wears a size L. We went up to an XL and it fits his arms perfectly and is not too baggy (I would size up). The Black sand is almost like a dark charcoal/graphite vs. a black. He loves the jacket and we would highly recommend!
review.name: Husband's Bday Present

review.reviewBody: I wear several generations of these pants, not yet retiring any.  I wear them daily, year round (with long underwear in winter) for casual wear, working outside and camping /hiking.   They are comfortable with room to move and additional stretch, durable and dry quickly.  My oldest pair have a definite outdoor attributes. while now they are fundamentally pants with generous zippered pockets.  My newest pair adds in a waist cinching feature.  Very good value for the cost.

These pants check all the boxes. Fit is perfect, 36 short is the perfect length. 15% spandex provides great stretch and still blocks most of the wind. Also appreciate the number of zipper d pockets. Only recommendation would be to include zipper pulls on all pockets. These pants would be great for any outdoor activity and are stretchy enough to accommodate thin long underwater on colder days.

I recently received these and already put them through the wringer. I'm usually not a reviewer but I feel these deserve it-- especially with my last hike. I was out in the middle of nowhere, bush-wacking most of the way, thick brush, deep mud, hot with the Colorado sun beaming down, and these things held up great. I was comfortable temp, still easy to maneuver in the wicked terrain, good protection from the sun and everything else, and they cleaned up perfect in the wash. Love the fit. No belt needed. Highly recommend.
review.name: Lightweight and durable

review.reviewBody: The pants are well made with stretchy durable fabric. I can use them for everything from running to hiking and climbing etc. I'd give them a 10 but the waist is a little loose the rest of the fit is perfect.
review.name: Nice pants

review.reviewBody:
Great year-round trousers, these  layer well. The seat does not sag as is typical with trousers made of similar fabrics. They launder,dry quickly,travel and store well. The belt loops make these practical for travel;trail to lunch or dinner and back to trail if circumstances call for same.
Great for any level of experience.
review.name: Great year round ultra light trousers.

review.reviewBody: The pants are well made and fit me perfectly. I look forward to wearing them on my next adventure to the Galapagos Islands.

I've used these for both climbing and hiking/backpacking and they have performed great in both aspects. After scraping against rock or hiking over deadfall there are no tears or holes and have held up great. They are thin and let wind/cold through, but that is expected for a pair this lightweight.
review.name: Solid lightweight pants

review.reviewBody: Love these pants. Great for sun protection on summer days, and the perfect weight for shoulder-season as well - have hiked in them on cool mornings (45F/7C) as well as while working hard up hills on warmer days (62F/17C) and they felt great - super breathable, ultralight, really stretchy and comfortable.
review.name: Like they're barely there

review.reviewBody:
I think the first thing that stands out about these pants is how slim/modern fashion fit they are. I don't think that's necessarily a bad thing but just important to know. I am 6' 0" 165lbs with athletic build, moderate size runners legs (not elite marathon legs thin and not squat guru tree trunks either) and they are very form fitting. I wear a 32 in most all pants and these fit well, the material will stretch but just fits right over my lower leg and thigh and butt but not necessarily utilizing the stretch, if that makes sense. 

While the material is thin and shear feeling I actually think it might be surprisingly durable if used for some climbing or scrambling, but I haven't put it to that use yet, but I think while they are form fitting the stretch would allow quite a bit of mobility.

Anyway, for now they have served well as a well made, nice color choices, functional pant that looks pretty stylish. I'm enjoying them but they not might be right for everyone.
review.name: Slim but nice

name: Runbold Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I've been trying wider saddles, based on the current tech that women need the wider saddles. I've not totally convinced, but I did try some wider saddles. I tried at least 4 brands and liked this the best. I'm not sure I've ridden it enough, but it seems good for me.
review.name: So far, so good

review.reviewBody: I am a fan of Ergon! They understand physiology. I have used the mountain bike version of this saddle (SM Pro) and loved it, so I bought this for my gravel bike. The first trip on this saddle I went 20 miles with no issues of even a hint of discomfort. Now long rides are a joy again. (The stock saddle that came on my new Checkpoint was not a good fit at all.) I did find that switching to a S/M, rather than a M/L made a big difference in comfort for me. I highly recommend this saddle for road or gravel bikes, and the SM versions for mountain bikes.
review.name: Comfortable From the Start!

review.reviewBody: The fabric on this shirt is the best I've found, super light weight and breathable, so it works perfectly on the hottest days. The fit is wonderful; plenty long in the sleeves and body. The hood fits perfectly and even covers the chin if needed. Love the ponytail hole! This is my go-to sun shirt!
review.name: Best Sun Shirt on the Market

review.reviewBody: The hoodie is made of a super lightweight and soft fabric; I've worn it in the field a couple times, the hood works well to keep the sun off my neck and face, but the fabric has gotten a couple pulls from bush whacking through thick understory growth.
review.name: Super lightweight sun hoodie

review.reviewBody: Not gonna lie, I wasn't sure this hoodie was going to live up to the reviews, but it does. It *is* somehow cooler than bare skin in hot weather. I also wasn't sure about the fit before ordering. I don't like things tight. I'm a 36B and the large fits perfectly. It skims without being clingy or constricting, and is surprisingly flattering. The rhubarb color is especially sharp!
review.name: No exaggeration

review.reviewBody: Not only is the cut absolutely flattering but this shirt actually cools you down. I almost wanted to throw away all my other sun shirts because non come close to the comfort and protection this one provides.
review.name: An amazing sun shirt!

review.reviewBody: Buying another one. Super fast drying even in the humid gulf coast climate. I wore it on a boat for sun protection. It was so comfortable and did not make me hot (ter than I would have been) and may have actually kept me cooler by keeping the sun off.
review.name: Softest, most comfortable sunshirt I own

review.reviewBody: Good quality with comfortable fit. I have another just like this and the wear is great!
review.name: Lightweight, comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is my new everything hoodie. You'll catch me biking, hiking, and doing trail work in this. I'll even wear it to the office. An all-around great piece that is flattering and functional.
review.name: My everything hoodie...

review.reviewBody: Wore this sun hoodie on a recent backpacking trip, it kept me very comfortable while moving. Super lightweight, but doesn't feel fragile. Love the style of the hood and the thumb holes. Excited to try it out in warmer weather.
review.name: Great versatile layer

review.reviewBody:
I have worn this hoodie on three hikes since I received it. Of the two other brands I own, this is by far the most breathable and most comfortable fabric, and has become my new favorite. It is also much less see-through than I expected, and launders well.

Be sure to go by the size chart! I didn't; I just ordered the same size (large) as my other two hoodies expecting the same fit. This size large is a TRUE size large, and even the sleeves are long on me (for reference, I'm 5'3" 135#). This is my new favorite hoodie, even though it's big on me!
review.name: Most breathable sun hoodie I've tried

review.reviewBody: I've had my echo sun hoody for at least 4 years and it's still one of my go-to adventure shirts. Love the ponytail opening and breathable yet protective material. I've hiked in this shirt anywhere from 1 mi to 20+ in a day. I only wish OR would make the women's shirt in some muted earthy tones (like the men's) !! I would keep buying them, but I'm sick of neon and grey!
review.name: Love this shirt, wish it was in different colors!!

review.reviewBody: Cute and cozy pants but they run big and stretch out throughout the day. I would recommend sizing down if youâ€™re between sizes.
review.name: Cute but big

review.reviewBody:
Love the look of these shorts, did buy them a full size too big (should have gotten a small). Luckily after washing on hot and drying a few times high heat they ate the perfect size now!

SHRINK IN WASH IF TOO BIG*
review.name: 5â€™3â€ 135lbs bought size M

review.reviewBody:
I loved the high waist and they looked super cute! However, the cut of the bottom makes them extreme booty shorts! They are long enough, but if you lean forward a bit everyone gets a good view of your cheeks XD.
It was bad enough I had to return them
review.name: Weird Cut

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a L in pants. Sadly this one runs very lage and I had to return them.
review.name: Runs large

review.reviewBody: I like the fit and the fabric. They are high waisted but I think they are adorable. I bought a second color.
review.name: Awesome shorts

review.reviewBody: I really love how these shorts fit and look. The super high rise is my favorite, because I love tucking my shirts in pretty much always. They wash well and move well. The only reason I gave 4 stars, is because the pockets are less functional than I wish they were. Having huge front pockets smack dab in the front of the hip means it's hard to walk up stairs or hills if you have your phone in your pocket, and the back pockets aren't big enough for a phone. If they keep these shorts around, I hope they deepen the back pockets. It wouldn't change the look of the shorts at all and it would make them a lot more functional.
review.name: Great shorts, awkward pockets

review.reviewBody: Love! The sizing, the length, the cut, the pockets! I want to get a second pair.
review.name: Favorite Shorts

review.reviewBody: I got the white and they're so cute! I love how they flair out a little. Ashley Bell on instagram looks like she has these too, so great for tall girls too. I got a small and they fit great. I could have tried on an xs but my waist is like 26 inches so I usually go with a bigger size.
review.name: SO CUTE

review.reviewBody: I love these high waisted shorts, super cute for city wondering or a hot day hike! I sized up in these shorts since I have curvy hips and muscular thighs. For reference I am 5'8'' 165lbs and  a size 10 in pants and the large fit best.
review.name: Cute Shorts!

review.reviewBody: These shorts are super cute on, you can dress up or dress down. I ordered a size medium, and wish I ordered a small, but making them work. I am typically a size 4 or 27.
review.name: Very cute

name: Venture Short - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover - Plus - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love everything about this top. If there was one thing that could be altered, I think it would be optimal for the cowel neck to be a touch shorter- more of a mock neck.
review.name: Love the fabric

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover - Plus - Women's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this fleece cowl! I wish I could wear it all the time!
review.name: Like a hug

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover - Plus - Women's
review.reviewBody: This ia lighter weight but not too thin fleece. It's very warm. I wish the bottom was a little less fitted. When sledding it kept ridding up.
review.name: Very warm for the thickness.

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover - Plus - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this cowl pullover. I originally bought it in a gorgeous blue and then went back for another. Sand is the perfect neutral for all your every day and hiking needs. I don't wear a lot of white, so I was worried this would be more pale/white leaning. But it was perfection. It is insanely soft, warm, while being breathable. It packs well and has been perfect for traveling, hiking and layering, everyday wear... perfect weekend cozy, rainy day top. If you're unsure if you'd like it, give it a try, it will definitely surprise you. Oh, and the blue color pops gorgeous in Antelope canyons, Zion, Bryce Canyon and the Grand Canyon's gorgeous colors. I'd highly recommend this... or getting more than one (tbh)
review.name: I have it un multiple colors

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover - Plus - Women's
review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) Super warm, very comfy, and as a winter hiking layer absolutely perfect! Wearing this I stayed warm on a -15c day with a windchill of -25! This is not a windproof layer so I did need an outer layer but it was that little extra that kept me toasty!!!
review.name: Warm and comfy

name: Trail Mix Cowl Pullover - Plus - Women's

review.reviewBody: Quality and color are excellent, and it withstood some pretty cold weather.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I always tend to wear bibs but decided to try out these pants and let me tell you, they are amazing. They arenâ€™t like other ski pants. They are high waisted and so comfy. And itâ€™s so easy to pee.
review.name: Best pants ever

review.reviewBody: Like the jacket, these run big. I got my normal size and they were falling off of me
review.name: Runs big

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™m usually a bibs gal but these pants are everything I couldâ€™ve wanted!!! And the waist actually fits unlike so many brands!
review.name: BUY THEM

review.reviewBody: Never have I ever fit in a medium ski pant due to my athletic built. Iâ€™ve always had to buy large that required alterations. Let me tell youâ€¦ with these pants I was able to buy my actual size (medium) and they fit like a GLOVE. Not to mention the high waist which is (chefs kiss) 1
review.name: Amazing fit

review.reviewBody:
I got the bib a month ago and sent it back for these pants (the bib was too restrictive, but insulated) and I was so excited to see what these pants had to offer and was so disappointed pulling them out of the bag. First these pants are definitely more applicable to spring skiing weather they feel more like a shell than a genuine snow pant, you would freeze even with a base layer on especially in the middle of January. And I sized up bc the bib was too restrictive my mistake bc these were huge on me, so while I get a bib and snow pant are different in stitching and what not the sizing between the two needs to be way better in similarity. Also while they are big there is too much tension in the legs/backside to get into a comfortable ski position if youâ€™re an avid skier. Also their outfits need more pockets. We are skiers we would be lost without our pockets
The color options though are amazing that is the one upside compared to other brands and I get this is a new company, but theres so so much more room for growth and potential. This outfit is good for an Xgames look, but not functional enough save your money youâ€™re better off buying from any other ski brand.
review.name: Needs work
comment: Hi there, thank you so much for submitting your review. We're so sorry to hear that your recent experience with us did not live up to your expectations. Rest assured your feedback has been passed along to our teams so we can do better in the future!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and length. Do not size up. I am 5â€™11â€ and could have used one more inch on the length but theyâ€™re good enough, especially compared to most other brands. These are flattering for sure! Not a lot of pocket space, but I guess thatâ€™s to be expected if you want a slimmer fit!
review.name: Impressed with these pants.

review.reviewBody: Bluebird color is beautifu! I wish they still sold this color in the Lawrence jacket. Clearly great quality just from looking at them! Sizing is a bit tricky. I am a size 4-6 and ordered the  medium because it was all that was left (but would normally order a small). With the waist sinch on the backside of the waist, I think they will fit and I'm not sure the small would've have been big enough. I haven't worn them to the mountain yet but I'm looking forward to testing them out to see if they are warm enough!
review.name: Great quality and beautiful color

review.reviewBody: Love so comfortable and flattering. I wore them in 20 degree weather and never got cold or wet. Note they are a bit high waisted if you donâ€™t like that
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for warm, durable ski gear, and I went with Halfdays because it's made for women, by women! I love the Alessandra Pant â€” the material feels really cozy on the inside, smooth on the outside, and the adjustable high waist is unbelievably flattering. I'm 5'4" and ordered the XS. These are my favorite pants, they're perfect!
review.name: Cutest ski pants out there

name: Alessandra Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Really nice and versatile use. Folds out with plenty of space for most types of ropesâ€¦.easy to organize rope for leading and accessories.
review.name: Excellent rope bagâ€¦

review.reviewBody: Tough, durable, and fits a lot of rope. I have an 80m and thereâ€™s still plenty of space
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: tarp is more than big enough for my 70m rope. Easy to pack and carry to the crag. Little bit of room for some other items in there too, but I just use it to carry the rope
review.name: Great rope bag

review.reviewBody: Does what itâ€™s meant to, nothing more, nothing less. Seems durable and holds my 9.8 70m no problem, side pouch is nice for keys but not much else, the tarp seems to be deteriorating a bit faster than I would like but I think it should hold for around 2-4 seasons
review.name: Rope bag

review.reviewBody: This is a great bag, as a petit woman, I like the fit. Holds my rope and some gear but not a lot of room for shoes...snacks or water
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody:
This bag is great for carrying rope, or gym equipment. I've seen reviews stating that there is plenty of room for rope, harness, and shoes, but for the life of me it's either been rope or gear. I mainly gym climb so I have a 40M 10.1 mm rope and it takes up pretty much all of the space with the exception of maybe squeezing a harness. All in all I don't have anything bad to say about the bag, but I can imagine anything above a 50M rope would be difficult to fit in this bag.

The tarp is a very nice feature though. keeps your rope off the ground and it makes packing your rope away fool proof.
review.name: Convenient rope tarp, little storage

review.reviewBody: Great rope back. Easy to pack in and out of the crag. The option to carry it as a duffel or a backpack is really nice, as is the price!

name: Rope Bag

review.reviewBody: Havenâ€™t had a chance yet to try these by the pool but they look very cute on.
review.name: Fits true to size

review.reviewBody: These sandals are very comfortable to wear.  They are strong and flexible. I wear them everyday around the house.
review.name: Hydro Slide sandals

review.reviewBody: Very Comfortable, a little larger than I expected.
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I got these slides for going in and out of the backyard for watering plants etc.  I love them.  They fit as I like and hug my foot well with a comfortable foot bed and the cushion and traction is great.  However, I made a huge mistake and left them outside in the sun and they shrunk.  So, I'm ordering another pair.  Just be careful where you store them; other than that, they are a great slide.
review.name: Getting another pair, but....

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shoes easy on and off. I would recommend these to anyone who likes comfortable shoes
review.name: Customer

review.reviewBody: I have only been buying Merrell shoes for sometime now. The reason is they fit me so well and there is such nice cushioning in the shoe, especially the heel and this shoe is no exception. I use them for slippers and wear socks. They hold your foot in place and slip on easily.  I am in my 60s and need that extra cushioning. Theyâ€™d be great water shoes also though. I wear a womens 10 and I have always ordered that size and it always fits.
review.name: Comfortable shoe

review.reviewBody: I did need to return for next size down- I always wear a size 9, but these had to be an 8, because I needed them for kayaking, and didn't want them slipping off. The 8's were a little tight at first along the top of my feet, but they have relaxed a bit and are perfect now. When not camping they stay at the back door for trips out to the back yard with the dogs.
review.name: Perfect for water shoes
comment: Thank you for sharing your great review!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these sandals! I had bunion and hammer toe surgery so I can no longer wear sandals that go between my toes. I love these because they give my feet support and they look so stylish and are extremely comfortable for all day wear!
review.name: Comfortable and Stylish
comment: We appreciate your valuable feedback. Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us!

review.reviewBody: I recently bought these sandals, which I don't like as much as I'd hoped. Although I have narrow feet, the sandal on the left foot is tighter on the foot. I have to wait for the warmth of the skin to soften the material before the sandals feel more comfortable.
review.name: Not as confortable as desired

review.reviewBody: These are so comfortable. Itâ€™s my second pair. The original style I had had more vent holes in the top so therefore it was cooler. My foot gets a little warm in this slide. But I could wear it along time!
review.name: Super comfy/a little warm

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve only taken these boots ou once but they were amazing in knee deep snowshoeing. Over 6hrs and not a single drop and my feet were very warm. Used Petzl crampons with them also and they worked amazingly well. Iâ€™m usually a size 13 US and ordered the same in this boot and it was perfect. No break in time really and felt great from the get-go. Great mountaineering boot for any price. I will attempt Mont Blanc, Elbrus, Matterhorn, and more in these.
review.name: Awesome boots

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love these boots - they're my go to for shoulder season backpacking and summer mountaineering here in the Pacific Northwest. They have just enough flex to be comfortable on long approaches, and stiff enough to kick-steps through scree & snow.

The boots fit true to size, with a marginally wider toebox (more akin to Scarpa than La Sportiva).

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I picked up a set of these before our trip to the Black Hills of South Dakota. I had planned to wear them to break them in before the trip. The first time I truly wore them was on our first hike took us through multiple creek beds. If it's more comfortable and I truly get my feet dry. I would highly recommend these boots to anyone else.
review.name: True GTX boots!

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The boots feel really solid/waterproof. So far I've only trudged though the forest a few times in snow without any issues at all. Very happy. Toe box is narrow so be aware if you have a wide foot. I sized up half a size and they were perfect
review.name: so far so good

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bottes de trâˆšÂ®s belles qualitâˆšÂ©, semble solide (pas assez utilisâˆšÂ© pour le dire). Languette matelassâˆšÂ©e trâˆšÂ®s confortable.

TrâˆšÂ®s belle couleur 

Je fais du 12 US normalement et j'ai pris du 12.5 et c'est parfait
review.name: Superbe qualitâˆšÂ©

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is an amazing pair of boots. The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is that a bit more cushion is needed in the sole. I  recently wore these boots while ice fishing and hiking in ankle deep snow for a week. Had no issues with my feet getting wet or cold.
review.name: Warm Boots

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've have 5 short hikes to date in these boots. Initial impression was the boots are a bit snug even going up a half size.   With a good hiking sock there was room for my toes but felt tight across my foot. By hike 4 I've adjusted to the feeling and I'm glad I choose the size I did.   These boots can accommodate a wide foot but would not recommend for an extra wide foot. 

Laces seem to slip a bit if not double knotted.  I've not tested in any extreme temps yet, so far 25-60F they're been great.  Grip is perfect so my uses so far. 

Plenty of support and the color combinations are fun. I've been a Marine fan for some time, these match well with the other Mammut products.
review.name: Great feel

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Used heavily on dry glaciers and rock! Performs well, pretty narrow to box, but the my best fit. Would be great for late season conditions in the cascades or in the rocky mountains during the summer. Solid water proofing, maybe use gaiter if you are marching all on snow!
review.name: Great 3 season boot

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Wore it on one expedition into Swiss Alps had various conditions work them in fro
snow shoe, crampon and boot punch through 2-3ft slushy wet snow held up great waterproofing solid and laces didn't get loose once while wearing gaiters.  Some sore pinky toe spots and very marginal heel lift wearing light weight hiking socks.  Overall solid boot. Only reason it doesn't have 5 stars is cant tell about durability with just one multi day trip.
review.name: Solid 3.5 season mountaineering boot

review.itemreviewed: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are very comfortable for alpine boots. I've taken them out on a long day hike to break them in and I didn't have any blisters at all. Looking for to wearing them into alpine terrain.

name: Kento Advanced High GTX Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
From the first time I first wore these shoes they felt good: support where it was needed, nice room in the toe box. I appreciated the tab to pull the tongue forward as needed and the tab on the heel also assisted getting the shoe on right. 
My feet felt good after a couple of hours on trails. 
Since I am also interested in looking nice while Iâ€™m out hiking with friends, I really liked the warm chocolate shoe with dusty teal and rose accents. The sole in a shade of brown was a good choice for me to pair with darker pants in the cool season. 
I am pleased with both the comfort and the look. Also, I tie the knot loops after I initially tie the laces and this second knot seems to keep them tied.
review.name: Good fit + good look

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These hiking shoes are very light and comfortable. The only annoying thing is the laces don't stay tied, even when double knotted. That and I was disappointed that the color is more muted & not as vibrant as in the picture.
review.name: Very comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Plan to use these in an upcoming trip. Love the color. Good looking. Very comfortable for an older gal with a bunion!
review.name: Great

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Nice shoe and it fit correctly. Awesome sole. But it slid at least an inch on my heel and I had to return.
review.name: Heel is too loose

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: We are required to wear non-slip shoes at work. The waffle soles are perfect. Also I frequently walk through wet grass, and these keep my feet dry. I use insoles since I had plantar fasciitis. At first my outer foot joint on one foot rubbed. My coworker said to try thicker socks, which worked. I imagine next summer they won't need thicker socks. I usually prefer narrow sized footwear. These work well. They stay tied with a double tied bow. They are great for loosening dirt on the ground at work. My feet always feel great and I have no pains in my heels or back. I am 60 years old.
review.name: Great shoe for work

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Teva is my favorite brand of shoes. I garden a lot. I wanted a waterproof shoe. These are not as comfortable as the Hurricane or the Fisherman, but they work, with my orthotic. I have a slightly club foot.
review.name: Not Perfect, but Good

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have other Teva boots, so I ordered my usual size. This style fits great in the toes, but is a little loose in the back. It's not such a problem that the shoe is coming off, but it is enough to rub and get annoying after wearing for several hours.
review.name: Not my favorite Teva

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really liked the style of the shoe but was disappointed in the fit: there is absolutely no arch support. the insole is perfectly flat; I generally wear a medium width but this shoe is much wider [perhaps I should have known that, since it doesn't come in different widths.]
review.name: too wide

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoes were nice but I have a bunion and the seams rubbed up against that part of my foot and I could not wear them.
review.name: Didn't work for me

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these shoes, but I can't. These shoes are overly stiff, do not break in at all, cause blisters on your toes and heels and have a massive seam in the middle of the heel that is incredibly irritating. I tried to break them in over several hikes before a big trip. They never got better, and mid-vacation I ended up having to purchase a pair of Altra Lone Peaks. The Altras saved my feet and needed no break in time and I didn't get any additional blisters once I made the switch.
review.name: Blisters everywhere

name: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Been a long time supporter of Cotopaxi but itâ€™s been awhile since Iâ€™ve bought anything brand new and this Vuelta is simply incredible. I LOVE the stretch. Itâ€™s lightweight, great quality and is a great piece to have in your closet especially during those transitioning seasons, cool nights or frigid AC indoors. I got the orangey terracotta color and itâ€™s beautiful. Itâ€™s true to size and it has become such a daily staple stowed in my bag that I ordered the grey! The vents really help keep you cool as needed. The material also wards off wrinkles so itâ€™s another nice plus.
review.name: Great solid piece!

review.reviewBody: I have a few pieces of clothing and a couple of bags. I love everything!
review.name: Love Cotopaxi Gear

review.reviewBody: Very lightweight and comfortable material. Good fit too. All of the Cotopaxi products I've tried are durable and last.
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: I like my jacket a lot. I love the style, material, and color. The zipper reaches up to protect the neck, and the shape of the hood is just right. I wish there were at least one pocket that had a zipper closure. There is no safe place for a phone or small coin purse.
review.name: Windbreaker Jacket

review.reviewBody: This windbreaker is perfect for a windy day or for a lightweight layer on a rainy day. I live on the East Coast and Iâ€™ve worn this windbreaker on the boat in overcast conditions, over a tank top on a windy day, and over a t-shirt on an airplane to combat the chill. Iâ€™m looking forward to wearing it as an additional layer while hiking in Utah later next month as I know it will not let me down. Itâ€™s not water resistant but it does dry quickly if it gets wet. Itâ€™s so packable and hardly takes up any room at all which is another bonus!!! All around it is the perfect addition to your wardrobe!!
review.name: Womenâ€™s Vuelta Performance Windbreaker Jacket

review.reviewBody: I love my new wind jacket - functional and beautiful color - it's the color of the canyonlands of southern Utah.
review.name: Wonderful wind coat in cool color

review.reviewBody: good quality and perfect fit but the 2 pockets have no zippers.
review.name: Windbreaker Jacket

review.reviewBody: I loved discovering your store in NW Washington State. So glad I went in. I was given a Cotopaxi fanny pack by my employer but before then had never heard of you. I love the jacket. I'm glad I saw it on the way out of the store. It said buy me and I'm so glad I did. Love everything about it!!!
review.name: Great Jacket!!

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™m so glad that I purchased this jacket. The fabric of the jacket is just perfect . I love it so much. Thank you, Cotopaxi!
review.name: Vuelta performance windbreaker jacket

review.reviewBody: Not only does my Cotopaxi Windbreaker work well but It sure makes me look GREAT! Isn't that the ultimate - works well, looks great, makes me feel awesome wearing it!
review.name: Windbreaker Jacket that blows with the Wind

name: Vuelta Performance Windbreaker - Women's

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Helio LX Pressure Shower online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Helio LX Pressure Shower
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Helio LX Pressure Shower online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I love the idea of this shower. I used it for the past week for some off-grid camping. It workedâ€¦sort of. Flaw #1 is that the water pressure is very inconsistent. The foot pump worked well to pressurize the tank, but then the flow of water from the nozzle only worked well half the time. Sometimes great, sometimes not at all. As others have noted, sometimes it seemed to work better if I wasnâ€™t holding the nozzle too high off the ground. But sometimes it worked great even at 6â€™ up. I checked for kinks in the hose under the bladder but nothing seemed visibly wrong. Iâ€™m not sure what the solution is, but I wasnâ€™t impressed. 

Flaw #2: It doesnâ€™t solar heat very well. I had it in direct sunlight (80 degree days) for 8-10 hours and the hottest I could get it was about 95 degrees. Not terrible, but definitely not a hot shower. Iâ€™ve used cheaper solar showers (the gravity hang variety) and they heat super well in the sun in a fraction of the time. Iâ€™m guessing itâ€™s because of the vertical design of the LXâ€”not enough surface area? Or maybe too much black/too little clear plastic? My gravity solar shower is completely clear on top, black on bottom, and has a ton of surface area. Heats up GREAT. 

Conclusion: Itâ€™s a good effort and seems to be decently made, but itâ€™s definitely not perfect. Yet. I have high hopes for future versions.
review.name: Great conceptâ€”almost awesome shower. Two flaws.

review.reviewBody: I got this after trying a few 12V showers I had seen in ads. They never had enough sustained pressure for me and wanted something simple. This shower has exceeded my expectations. After pumping up the canister with the foot pump the pressure is maintained for a couple of minutes. Its perfect when you need a shower in a pinch.
review.name: Truly Amazing

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™m very upset with this purchase. I bought this with the hopes of showering during my camping trip. The first time I used this I filled it all the way to the top. I learned quickly that was a mistake because it didnâ€™t leave room for the air pressure to build up and create the pressurized tank required to use this continue water flow shower. I removed some water, but it still didnâ€™t work properly. I wasnâ€™t able to get the shower to work holding it past my knee caps. I had to continuously use the foot pump to get water to come out. Save your money and purchase a gravity solar shower instead.
review.name: Does NOT Work As Advertised
comment: We strive to make reliable products that support you on your adventures and we're sorry to hear your shower is not working as it should. We appreciate your feedback and would like to bring in your shower for a warranty inspection. Please check your email for info from our customer support team.

review.reviewBody: pulled it out, made sure everything was there and functional.  We put it all away and it packed away easily and comfortably.  With a Lifetime warranty, we are pretty happy with it all.
review.name: First Day review

review.reviewBody: Excellent customer service.  Received the O-ring in about a week.  The shower works in a controlled environment.  Looking forward to trying in at our next camping trip!
review.name: Follow-up to "Almost excellent except for leaking"

review.reviewBody:
I bought the pressure shower brand new.  It worked great when the lid was not leaking air.  During the third use, the lid was leaking air preventing good pressure. I tightened the lid as much as I could, but the lid was still leaking.  We ended using a bucket and taking a sponge bath.

I took the lid off and noticed that the rubber gasket was missing.  If i could get the inner & outer diameter of the gasket, I would appreciate it.  If you sell this gasket, even better...

I would recommend this product if the leaking lid can be resolved.  If not, I can't recommend this product.
review.name: Almost excellent except for leaking lid.
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We'll reach out to you directly so that we may ship you a replacement o-ring/gasket. We're always looking for ways to improve our designs! Thanks again for leaving a review!

review.reviewBody: Seams at the pump valves on both sides split after two seasons, the hand faucet fell apart and the silicone strap that is supposed to secure the faucet open only got in the way of turning it on.
review.name: As others have noted - cheap components that fail.
comment: We strive to make products that reliably support you on your adventures. We're sorry to hear we're missing the mark. We appreciate your feedback and would like to bring in your shower for a warranty inspection. Please be on the lookout for an email from our customer support team.

review.reviewBody: I used this 2-3 times and the Nozzel is super cheap- the overall design of the Nozzel is cheap as well- plastic Chinese material at its finest. Trying to replace the Nozzel for something better... If debating about this vs a rinse kit- spend the money on a rinse kit-  putting the two next to each other the Nemo doesn't even compare.
review.name: Cheap Components

review.reviewBody: I love this camping shower!! We rustic camp on our property and use it for everything.
review.name: Foot pump has a hole in seam.

review.reviewBody: I've been using the shower for 2 months. The eyelet to hang the shower head tore off after about 2 days. The worst part is the shower head which is made of the cheapest plastic you can imagine. The trigger fell off multiple times until it flung off in a high grass where we couldn't find it anymore making the shower very hard to use.. It's priced as a premium product, so one would expect it to be made from at least average quality components..
review.name: Good potential but cheap components make it suck
comment: We strive to make reliable products that support you on your adventures and we're sorry to hear we're missing the mark. We appreciate your feedback and would like to bring in your shower for a warranty inspection. Please be on the lookout for an email from our customer support team.

name: Helio LX Pressure Shower

review.reviewBody: I started skiing over 30 years ago, and have ridden lots of gear over the years.  These are top notch in my opinion.  I bought mine at the beginning of last year's season. Excellent hold when you want your skis to stay on, but reliable release when you push a bit past your limits and eat snow.  They have a good range of DIN settings to suite a newer skier, but you can crank them down hard if you prefer to keep them in place.  For the bang for your buck, it would be hard to go wrong with the Marker Griffon 13's.  I have mine mounted on Nordica Soul Rider 97's.  It's been a really good match for riding everything from back country trails to bumps and jumps and a little park action.  Overall, I'm very pleased with them.
review.name: Fantastic bindings

name: Griffon 13 ID Ski Binding - 2025

review.reviewBody: I can't stop wearing this fleece. On hikes, to work, casual runs, the grocery store. It's relatively thin, making it perfect for layering under a shell and biking to work on those long sweaty hills. It's a cute boxy shape, which makes it easier to wear every day than the active fit fleeces. So soft and cozy. LOVE. I need more colors because the print is fun but becomes noticeable that I am literally wearing this every day.
Cozy light fleece layer! Roomy and beautiful color. Fits perfect, 5â€™ 110lbs.
review.name: Awesome half zip

review.reviewBody: Absolutely LOVE the purple patterned fleece. I've never gotten so many compliments on a fleece in my life, and its so cute in person. its such a light and comfortable layer, I lived in it my whole climbing trip. Perfect for chilly days that aren't too cold.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What a great thing for your pet or even as a gift! I had never heard such a thing but being someone who loves to hike with their dog, this is perfect! My dog kept it on and had no issues with it and it was something that I never knew I needed.
review.name: Awesome buy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Thinking about all of the summers I have had to wear nasty smelling bug spray or always having to find a candle to light, I have finally found something amazing that works! My family and I go fishing a lot, head into the woods and go boating. I am a mosquito attractor everywhere I go and it was getting very frustrating. This was super easy and so fun to try out. I just wrapped it around my neck or arm and continued on with my day, without a worry in the world about bugs. This works wonders! It does not have a strong scent, it is soft enough to be comfortable and it works. It is so much better than having to spray anything on my skin. Love this! Definitely recommend!
review.name: Very impressed with this!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I live in front of a wetland and let's just say the insects love me, but I don't love them. I love that I can put the bandana around my wrist or tied it around my belt loops. The insects are now leaving me alone. I would recommend this bandana to everyone.
review.name: Keeps insects away!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] my husband loves this, he swears by it! he ordered extra for his trip to Canada for his yearly fishing trip!! i highly recommend everyone adds one to their tackle bag.heck you could use this anywhere their are bugs!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Iâ€™m actually impressed at how well this bandana worked. Iâ€™ve been staying in because of the mosquitos. After wearing this bandana to a couple of outside gatherings, Iâ€™m happy at how well it repelled the mosquitos. I didnâ€™t have to worry about fighting them off or leaving the gatherings.
review.name: Actually Impressed!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this product - I do not like using deet on my face and this is a great alternative. It doesn't replace bug spray all together, but it definingly helps. I use it backpacking. Love the orange color and pattern and it help's my hubby's name is Ben LOL!
review.name: Great alternative to using dee

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved this because my son's name is Ben and he is constantly outside with many bugs and insects.  He was so excited about Ben'sÂ® Bandana with Insect Shield that he went on an adventure as soon as i gave it to him. It was a little warm but definitely helped keep the pesky misquotes away!

review.reviewBody: I got these at a black diamond sale and love them!! Just skied today while it was snowing and the snow rolled right off. I even wore them on my drive home because they were still dry! Not super insulated but not an issue because you can layer underneath. Itâ€™s also very lightweight and comfortable. For reference, I got a size L and am 6â€™0â€ and 205 lbs.
review.name: Great Ski Pants

review.reviewBody: comfortable fit, light feeling. So far only used inside ropes at resort
review.name: Recon Pants

review.reviewBody: Streamlined design, stretch, solid construction, these are bomber pants. I have put a few days in with them already and am extremely happy with their performance. Would highly recommend. The fit and stretch of these pants are fantastic.
review.name: Love these skit pants!

review.reviewBody: Waterproof, easy to layer underneath, no frills which I like. My prize thighs and big olâ€™ butt makes them fit more like jeans than snow pants, but at least I look good.
review.name: Good pants

review.reviewBody: Accurate description and fit. Very comfortable at the resort and touring.
review.name: Great ski pants

review.reviewBody: Design, fabric, fit and construction are outstanding! Quarter zip on lower leg adds versatility for boot buckle access, Attached belt has a very well designed buckle and the addition of large belt loops is an appreciated feature. Thigh vents are easy to access and use. Highly recommend these pants!
review.name: Awesome ski pants!

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve really enjoyed these pants. Great mobility for skiing; great shell sheds the wind and water.
review.name: Best shell pants yet

review.reviewBody: These stretch pants are terrific. Iâ€™m a 34â€ waist, 5â€™11â€ and 200 lbs and purchased size large. These pants fit perfect and provide the right ergonomic fit for making the perfect turns whether youâ€™re skiing hard in the backcountry or causally skiing down the groomed runs. Pair the pants with the Recon Stretch Pro Shell and you will be beyond satisfied!
review.name: Perfect fit, Looks Great & Keeps You Dry

review.reviewBody: Novice skier and while I didnâ€™t have any bad falls, no snow or ice went up my pants! I like how the pants are reinforced around where they go over the boots to provide protection against any roughness they may encounter. I went with a size large and for reference I am a size 34w-32l pant, 5â€™11â€ 195lb athletic build. I could wear a base layer and sweatpants under this no problem and honestly there would enough for more layers or thicker layers if needed.
review.name: Great ski pants

review.reviewBody:
using a tape and the fit guide helped me select the Mediums
There's a cool beacon pocket on the right leg front that is not in the description. There is a sleeve within the pocket to cradle and pad the beacon and there is a removable stretch lanyard. Looking forward to trying that in lieu of the chest harness
review.name: great cut for skiers

name: Recon Stretch Ski Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like this sweater â€” I love the stripesâ€” but unfortunately I found the neck to be uncomfortably small and the rest way too roomy and shapeless.
review.name: Neck too small, the rest too big

review.reviewBody: I love this top - but sadly had to return it. It fit perfectly in the body and arms, but the neck was tighter than I prefer (however, I like things loose). I could have worn it just fine, but I am trying to be wise with spending money on something - and justify only if I love every aspect of it.
review.name: Adorable Top

review.reviewBody: It snagged multiple times within 15 minutes of wearing it. Pretty disappointing especially considering the price point.
review.name: Great and cozy sweater, but snagging is an issue.

review.reviewBody: Fun color scheme and nice quality. Not too heavy and holds its shape well for this type of material. Runs large. Bought L and could also wear med for a more fitted look
review.name: Comfy sweater

review.reviewBody: This sweater is comfy cozy! I had no clue how it would fit, so I originally ordered it in an XL. It was WAY too bit. I went to the store and tried on a medium and it fit and was the most flattering, but I was concerned it would not be as comfy/might shrink/etc. The Large is slightly big on me, but I love the oversized vibe. My body falls between a medium and a large (depending on the brand), I have broad shoulders and a large chest. I got a lot of positive comments and I am super pleased with my purchase.
review.name: LOVE IT!

review.reviewBody: I bought this sweater for my daughter and she absolutely adores it. She says how itâ€™s very comfortable and oversized but in the best way! Definitely recommended!
review.name: Fits well and super comfortable!

review.reviewBody: The colors and the material was amazing!!! The neck . . . It was so frustrating. So tight that it felt it was sized for a kid not an adult. Iâ€™m a huge fan of mock necks but this felt like you were being strangled sadly. I couldnâ€™t keep it as I know Iâ€™d never wear it due to the neck. I was so bummed to have to return it
review.name: Wanted to love this soooo much

review.reviewBody: I love this sweater. It is soft and comfortable. It runs true to size. My favorite part is the extra long sleeves.
review.name: New Favorite Sweater

review.reviewBody: This sweater is perfect. Great quality, great style, great cause.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I love this jumper and was so pleased with it. But unfortunately have found it not to be very durable, I havenâ€™t washed it yet and already there are many snags and pulls in the knit which has massively effected the look of it. I try to be extra careful with it but still this seems to happen which has been really disappointing as it was quite an expensive item.
review.name: Beautiful sweater

name: Libre Waffle Crewneck Sweater - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner is always with me, if I am not using to stay extra toasty in my bag, I use it as a pad sheet for sleeping on during the hot desert nights. Absolute must have for any serious outdoors person
review.name: Perfect kit addition

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best purchase ever! I bought this for the COLD fall nights backpacking in Glacier Park, and it did not disappoint. Keeps me toasty warm. I love the light weight, and it packs down fairly small. The baffles and extra down in the hood are great touches. Would 100 percent recommend this sleeping bag.
review.name: Sea to summit Spark Down zero degree sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't taken this bag out yet but I've tested it at home and it's feather-light and so comfortable. We're going backpacking this weekend and I'll report back.
review.name: so soft and warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag has just about every feature you could wish for. You can unzip the arm area, the foot area, and fully unzip it to use as a blanket. You can even zip two bags together! It cinches up around the head and neck area to keep in maximum warmth. Itâ€™s also filled with goose down, allowing it to be both breathable and incredibly warm. What Iâ€™m still blown away by is the weight- it comes it at under 2 lbs and compresses down into a very small pack. This is perfect for overnight hikes where every ounce matters. Iâ€™m so excited to bring this along for cold weather camping!
review.name: High Quality, Lightweight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this sleeping bag!!! It is probably the most comfortable, well insulated sleeping bag I've ever owned! I've attached pictures of it unrolled with no one in it, and a pic of me inside with room to spare! The hood attachment part is probably the best part in my opinion. No more cold heads when camping! Rolling it back up for storage was also super easy, which is always a plus. I would definitely recommend this to anyone camping, especially in colder climates!
review.name: Best sleeping bag ever!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Spark Pro Down Sleeping Bag 15F is a dream of a bag for ultralight backpacking. It packs down incredibly small, making it a great choice for long treks where every ounce counts. This high-performance bag is also comfortable and toasty, with a roomy ergonomic mummy shape that offers a good balance of warmth and wiggle room. This is an excellent choice for serious backpackers.
review.name: Ultralight and toasty comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Planning to go camping this October and I am so excited to use this sleeping bag. Iâ€™ve tested it out outside and it is so snug and comfy, I am happy to be able to put it to use soon. Literally canâ€™t wait to camp using this sleeping bag
review.name: Lightweight and awesome!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really nice sleeping bag!  Not to warm not too cold this sleeping bag is just right.  Very soft and compresses nicely to fit in the included carrying case.
review.name: Really nice sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and soft material. I love that their are zippers on the side to vent but also you can take your arms out. Folds up small and has a carrying case so it doesn't take up a lot of space.
review.name: Very warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is the nicest one Iâ€™ve ever seen and will use! It is extremely lightweight but still able to keep you toasty warm. It unzips two different ways so you can roll down the front flap or just unzip one side. It has snaps and bungee cords you can use to help lock in warmth and make sure you are keeping out the cold. The stuffing feels thin but that also helps it to compact and easily put back in the compression bag and storage carrier. This wonâ€™t add hardly any weight if you are backpacking into your camp. The size is great for one person but there is an option to zip two bags together to share. And I love that there are accessories available to buy separately for it like a pillow and an inflatable pad. Which if you are sleeping on rocky ground, youâ€™ll probably want as this doesnâ€™t have much â€œpaddingâ€. This sleeping bag is warm but breathable and for anyone who camps, this is expensive but definitely worth the quality to have.
review.name: Wow!

name: Spark Pro Sleeping Bag: 30F Down

review.reviewBody:
The shoes are well constructed, but the wide shoes arenâ€™t wide. They are not built for a full grown manâ€™s  feet and therefore feel like womenâ€™s shoes. Stop with the unisex sizing, it doesnâ€™t work. 

The high tops are wider than the low tops.

review.reviewBody: The shoes are really nice, pretty and you can really tell that are wider than a normal NB shoe. Perfect in my opinion.
review.name: Very very nice product

review.reviewBody: Even if you are normal width, opt for the wide sizes. As someone with a wide foot this particular shoe is narrow compared to New Balanceâ€™s other shoes.

review.reviewBody: Definitely fit smaller then all the trail runner and running shoes ive tried. 11 wide in every pair of new balance I've had over the last 10 years. Wish there was an Xtra wide in these, tight and not that comfortable
review.name: Fits tighter/slimmer

review.reviewBody: I donâ€™t think I bought a pair of new balances in 30+ years. After using all of the other brands for years, I was surprised to see the quality of new balances. My small grip is that these are wide fit shoes, but the tongue has an elastic strap thatâ€™s a bit tight initially. IMy small grip is that these are wide fit shoes, but the tongue has an elastic strap thatâ€™s a bit tight initially. Iâ€™m sure it will loosen overtime.
review.name: Really well made

review.reviewBody: Love the style and fit, lots of compliments! Went with wides this time and much better. Have similar pair not wide and they are tight fitting.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Unisex design not the best for guys. I couldn't get my foot into it despite this being my size. Called NB and they said because the design is unisex, that actual dimensions of the shoe were a little different. If you are a guy and actually into sports, your foot might also not fit in this shoe.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Glad I got this for a trip to the BWCA. It worked perfectly.
review.name: Great product.

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these matts a couple years ago and used them dozen of times but on a very humid night both of them started to deflate. Back home, I checked them and found tiny holes on the top in the seam of the dimple (both matts had holes exactly on the same area). I'm going to fix them but I'm afraid to face this issue again as it seems to be a manufacturing defect.
review.name: Massive failure

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality and great comfort. This pad is not cheap but itâ€™s worth the money. Itâ€™s thick and firm enough for a side sleeper like me to sleep comfortably. And of course itâ€™s super lightweight, packs small. Best warm weather pad for side sleepers.
review.name: More comfortable than my foam pad!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My first mat left me on the ground 3 times after patching successive holes in the dimples. Was very unimpressed but contacted sea to summit and they replaced it. Have done 6 nites on the new mat without any problems. For sure a 3 season mat as fall here in Wyoming tested it's r-value. Very comfortable and less noisy compared to some higher r-value mats. Rate it a 3 which could improve if the replacement is more reliable.
review.name: The real review

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice and thick, but so noisy that it prevented me from sleeping all night. I ended up just sleeping on the ground instead. Won't be used again.
review.name: Thick, noisy

review.reviewBody: Comfortable for its weight and size. But loud. Not a deal breaker but not quiet like my comfort plus si.
review.name: Light and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Thickness is excellent. Although I am on the thicker side. The warranty is great should be a lifetime warranty for the price. My order came right on time.
review.name: Perfect pad

review.reviewBody:
Awesome for California weather, an upgrade from the last pad we had. The simplicity of blowing up and disinflate. I do recommend going with a large Iâ€™m not the tallest person and the regular isnâ€™t definitely too small. 

Great warranty program. Just wish they would through some stickers with your order.
review.name: Positive review

review.reviewBody: After struggling with an ultralight pad from another vendor, while a tad bigger and a little bit heavier, this solved my problem. At 6' and 200lbs, I can flatten out a poorly designed pad, and slide off. I fit on this pad and the material is not nearly as slippery as some. Inflation bag is a bonus. Perfect for late spring through early fall use.
review.name: Great Product..

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™m a side sleeper, and this mat with its four inch thickness is vey comfortable yet lightweight. Iâ€™ve only had it for a couple of months but it has performed flawlessly in that time. Very pleased with my purchase.
review.name: Ether Light XT

review.reviewBody: There is technically only fleece in part of these pants, the fleece is thin and not great quality. 100% not enough fleece to justify the price jump for the regular defend pants to the defend fire pants. The waist sits low, right where a hip pack sits. Combine that with uncomfortable top sew point and the plastic buckle makes for very uncomfortable riding and pedaling with a hip pack. The fly opening is very small which means itâ€™s hard to get on over my hips, and Iâ€™m not at all a curvy woman, yet I have to shimmy to get these on. I went by the size guide, ordered a small, probably could have gone with an xs. Iâ€™m 5â€™1â€ and 110lbs. The length is nice for shorter women. My poc knee pads fit fine under the smalls. Material is durable.

review.reviewBody: The Leatt 4.0 Enduro helmet feels very comfortable in half-shell configuration.  This is great for most trail rides and for climbing.  With the chin bar on it feels almost as protective as my DH helmet.  This helmet is great for long climbs with fast technical descents. I really like the added protection and have no issues with weight or comfort. The only issue I've found is that snapping on the chin bar can be finicky.
review.name: Great convertable helmet

review.reviewBody: This is a great helmet, but the sunglass dock doesn't work at all. The glasses just slide out of it, but the rest of the helmet works flawlessly. Don't know how I feel about the 360 Turbine yet, but from what I see I think it'll work great.
review.name: Great Helmet

name: MTB 4.0 Enduro Helmet

review.reviewBody: I am so glad that Dynastar started making a ski in this category!  The 108mm underfoot width is the most stable and versatile in my opinion.  Having that width in a very light ski means that I can tour uphill for many hours and be confident on my descent.  I have been able to put these ski through the wringer yet, but I did have a few very enjoyable days on them last season.  The float well in powder and they are quite light on the ascent.  Super solid Dynastar construction.  Nice flex pattern and sidecut.  I am 5'9" and 170lbs.  I use the 187cm.  Great for my needs.
review.name: The perfect backcountry touring weapon!

name: M-Tour 108 F-Team Ski - 2025

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I love this vest! 

I was looking for something that comes in a wider range of sizes. Iâ€™ve tried a few other brands of running vests, but none of them fit quite right. The 2XS fits me awesome, and it doesnâ€™t feel like Iâ€™m carrying anything, even if I pack it with my phone, keys, wallet, water, snacks, and a light jacket. 

The straws on the flasks are a little long, but I got used to that pretty quickly. 

Iâ€™m conscious that this is an investment, especially for someone whoâ€™s just starting their running journey, but itâ€™s given me such an improved experience as I learn to love running, so Iâ€™d recommend giving it a try!
review.name: Just what I was looking for!

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this for trail running and longer distances on hot days to replace my Camelbak which I found would dig into my shoulders on longer runs. This vest has been a game changer! It fits perfectly and distributes weight more evenly. As a petite woman, it can be hard to find equipment that fits well. The 2XS vest fit nice and snug. I don't even notice I'm wearing it.10/10 would recommend.
review.name: I love this vest!

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I'm a new runner and wanted to get a vest to use on my outdoor runs so I had somewhere to put my stuff and to have water on hand.
I like how adjustable it is and the fit of it, it doesn't chafe when I'm running and it doesn't add any extra bulk. I barely notice it when I'm running. 

Cons: 
- hard to find a generic bladder that fits the sleeve provided. 
- adjusting the straw length was a lesson in patience, way harder than it should be
- there are no replacements flasks for the women's vest, which is kind of a bummer
review.name: Great running vest

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this vest so much! I run medium distances and this vest is great for carrying water and snacks. I like to run to a destination, and I use this vest to carry a swimsuit, a wallet, my phone, etc. The only thing that is a little hard is cutting the straws, but it's definitely not impossible! Use boiling water and you should be fine.
review.name: Love this vest!!

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love my knew hydro pack! Have done several 20+ mile runs with it! So light weight and comfortable! My only complaint is I wish it was sold with the 1.5 liter bladderâ€¦they seem to always be â€œout of stock.â€
review.name: Super comfortable

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love this pack. I feel like it is such an upgrade from my last 2 packs (from other brands) This one is insanely comfy and just feels like an extension of my shirt, if that makes sense. It doesn't bounce and the storage is awesome. 
My only thing is why do the tube's for the chest bottles have to be so long? I still need to cut them but have been procrastinating since I've been hearing it's complicated. 
Either way, love love love this pack!!
review.name: Such an upgrade!! Love

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my first womenâ€™s vest and itâ€™s so much better than the unisex. The front water bottles fit nicely on the lower side of your chest.
review.name: Great for women!

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the colour in person. I find it fits a little tight for a small; 5'5" @ 125 athletic build but I naturally prefer items to be slightly less fitted. I am still playing with the straps to figure out what's cozy. Nonetheless it's great and I'm happy with it :)
review.name: Great colour, cozy fit!

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody: First impressions this vest seemed great. I knew the straws would be long, I am 6â€™ tall and they were still way too long for me. I watched Salomonâ€™s video on how â€œeasyâ€ they were to adjust. After 2 hours, many tools, many swears, and losing all the skin on my fingers I have semi adjusted straws. They are IMPOSSIBLE for any human to adjust. Really disappointed since the main function of the vest is supposed to be female specific easy hydration. Vest has a weird shape, even when empty it gives you a hunchback silhouette, but the pockets function well. Mostly itâ€™s the dang straws
review.name: STRAWS IMPOSSIBLE
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Use this for my long runs and ultras (two 50km races, training for my first 80km) and has held up great for over six months. I don't use the long straws as they are distracting near my face. I instead use the bottles with other Salomon caps, or I use my Harrier 500ml bottles.
My favourite thing about the vest is the amount of zippered pockets.
Overall, there is minimal movement, but eventually the vest starts to chafe at the neck at longer distances and in heat/humidity. I have taken to using kinesiology tape in that area to protect my neck.
review.name: So many pockets! Good size!

name: ADV Skin 12L Set Hydration Vest - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are so nice and soft-usually I can't wear wool next to skin but no itching. Just be aware that tops and bottoms run small. I am 5'3" and 120 lb and the medium long John's are skin tight. I had to re-order the top in large.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We just moved from Cali to Mich and bought a beautiful historic home... But it's drafty in our old home and our bodies aren't acclimated to "the seasons" yet so we wear these under our jeans pretty much all week and even when we go out! They wash in the washer nicely and they air dry quickly. They're wool so they don't get smelly. And even though they're wool, the leggings do not itch at all. They fit well (and true) and stay up without issue. It really does warm us up! We even bought the shirts for ourselves (got mens shirts tho).
review.name: Worth the investment

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for wearing every day, under everything, all winter long. Got the matching short sleeve, long sleeve, and leggings all in medium.
review.name: every day, under everything, all winter long

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and comforting and comfortable and shape-holding
review.name: I love them

review.reviewBody: For context, I am 5 ft 6, 170 lbs with very wide hips (48 inches) with a 37 inch waist, normally a size 16. Purchased the XL & I love the way that it fits snug but not constricting & from the first time wearing it feels very durable. I use them as leggings under my dresses when Iâ€™m in the office since I hate using a space heater since my office has an open floor plan.
review.name: 5 Stars for Fit

review.reviewBody: I love the weight, fit and feel of the fabric. However, the threads along the seams on the outside are fraying and I've only had them about two months. I'd suggest trying a different style seam.
review.name: Great fabric. Threads fraying on seams

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These leggins have been my winter wardrobe stalple for over 15 years. not sure i could survie the chill without them
review.name: I have purchased this product again and again

review.reviewBody: These are super cute sandals, typical comfortable Birkenstock fit and feel. The black oiled leather is a nice finish.  True to size: 39 is a solid 8.5. That said, after having the shoes for only 2 and 1/2 months, the cork bed has split on both shoes between the straps that criss-cross the top of the foot, specifically at the edge where the strap connects with the shoe, from foot bed to the base.  I have worn the shoes pretty regularly, about every other day for work, errands, and around the house. I've had several pairs of Birks in the past, but never had this happen. For the quality, these shoes aren't worth the money.
review.name: Great look and fit, poor quality

review.reviewBody: Love my Birks I have several colors and they are the most comfy shoe. Never had to break them in, They mold to my feet great.
review.name: Great Sandal

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these chairs after doing extensive research looking for an alternative to the heavy folding camp chair. This seemed like a great concept - light weight, packs small and doesn't have a flimsy carry bag that's difficult to get on and prone to ripping like many of the other chairs out there.
