review.reviewBody: Bought 2 Calyx helmets. For skiing, ear covers are theoretically useful. However, the ear covers do not securely connect to the helmet. They slip out easily when you remove the helmet. Very easy to lose. POC designed this helmet for combo ski/bike so the ear covers are not permanently attached. Someone blew the engineering on this and the cover insert clasps dont actually grip in the slot. POC customer care was friendly and just says return to retailer if you dont like it. Recommend avoiding this helmet.
review.name: Ear covers fall out

review.reviewBody: This helmet is way too small comparing to other POC helmets. The Fornix M fits me pretty well. I couldnâ€™t even put this helmet on my head. With the ear protection, itâ€™s gonna be smaller. Return it.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody:
PROs
I will start off by saying the design of the helmet is very nice! POC helmets are both practically and beautifully made. I own several of their bike helmets and they are all great quality. This helmet is also quite compact without feeling like you're losing out on protection which is hard to do the quality of materials in the helmet feels very nice. It fits very comfortably on the head and the adjustment strap in the back is the best I've used in a helmet. I would say weight-wise it feels like a cross between a bike helmet and a snowboard helmet (both of which I use) and that's ultimatley what attracted me to the product....but that price... Granted I got during their spring sale so it wasn't quite as steep but there are several things that I feel were not up to par for such an expensive product(even for the sale price).

Bullet PROs
+ Vents on the top work well
+Awesome multi-functional helmet design 
+ Helmet isn't to bulky
+Adjustment strap is fantastic
+ Nice Medium weight
+ (subjective) few really nice color choices

CONs
The strap, however, feels like an afterthought. First, it is quite scratchy... Like really not comfortable. Its ok when you're trying on the helmet but after using it for a whole day its very stiff and the materials feel like they cut into your chin a bit. (Its better with the balaclava buit you shouldnt need that ) I would not use it without adding a pad (which is not included with the product). For reference my $50 anon raider helmet has far more comfortabel straps for a 5th of the price. While I like the layout of the straps and how they sit around the ears this seems like a weirdly overlooked part. Secondly...NO MAGNETIC LATCH?!?! what? you can buy the Meninx helmet for $10 more and get the fidlock magnetic latch(which you can buy yourself online for $2)... so what gives? It feels like they spent a ton of time and resources designing the helmet itself and last minute the designers were like "Oh yeah it needs a strap..." and then grabed whatever leftover strap parts that had. I like the helmet itself so I dont think i will return it but I may mod on a new chin strap because this is laughable.

Bullet Cons
+Chin strap is scratchy material
+No magnetic latch?!?!
+Crazy expensive
review.name: Really Nice helmet... but $250?!

name: Calyx Helmet

description: Buy the Sportful Hot Pack Easylight Vest - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hot Pack Easylight Vest - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sportful Hot Pack Easylight Vest - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Love this vest so far, but the zipper is just abysmally cheap. It's one of those tiny all-plastic zippers, with microscopic teeth and a dinky pull-tab that's hard to use with gloved fingers. It's quite often that I'll go to zip up the vest, the zipper starts pulling up with the teeth out of sync, and the vest just flies open and the zip jams up. It's quite awkward to get it on, and the zipper materials seem like recycled McDonalds Happy Meal toys.

That being said, incredibly lightweight gilet and really easy to bring along on a ride (just make sure you stop for a few minutes to get it zipped up). It only takes up about half of a jersey pocket when it's stuffed down. Speaking of pockets, it only has one pocket on the back which is a bit awkward to get your hand into, but it's mostly there for the vest to pack into itself for transport, and it's nice to have a pocket on such a compact gilet to begin with.

Sizing is definitely on the small side, I'm 6'1" and 165lbs and I am absolutely stuffed like a sausage into a Large.
review.name: Nice lightweight vest, zipper is a joke

name: Hot Pack Easylight Vest - Men's

review.reviewBody: getting back into snowboarding after a 8 year break, the technology on these boots are amazing.  Great response, comfort and balance.

review.reviewBody: Tried two pairs, both have the problem that the side BOA on one of the boot produces a harsh irritating squeaky sound when tightened. This is brand new right out of the box when tried on for the very first time, which makes it feel like a design flaw. Also unable to get good locking of the ankle, ankle lifts up so much, much worse than the Launch BOA SJ.
review.name: BOA on the side of the boot makes squeaky sound
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody: At first I was a little worried that I would not like it because I was used to very soft boots, but now I think itâ€™s one of the best boots I ever had.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I've had two pair of the double zone boa Salomon Synapse boots over the last several years, now discontinued. Tried two other boots from other brands but came back to Salomon for this. They're generally the right stiffness (I like stiff bklts) and a near perfect fit, my only beefs are a little heel rise (had zero in the Synapse) that was mostly corrected with the included power bar/J-bars and right boot for whatever reason doesn't get as tight at the top so I have a lot of play at the shin. The Boas have a tendency to get loose but I expect that out of any boa, easy enough to tighten back up. I think these are worth trying on for anyone, but next time I'm boot shopping I'm going to try out more options and may ditch boas.
review.name: Decent replacement for my Synapse

review.reviewBody: I love this lightweight jacket. I think someone in another review said the arms were fairly narrow - and I agree with this. Fortunately, I have fairly thin arms or wouldâ€™ve had to send it back. I can even wear lightweight arm warmers underneath. I am 5â€™10 and 140-145 lbs, and have long arms - I got the large, and it fits perfectly.
review.name: Love this jacket.

review.reviewBody: most wind jackets are loose fitting. this is one of the fewer truly snug and fitted jacket I've found. it fits like a glove. I wear it all the time and I'm getting a 2nd color.
review.name: fitted jacket. love it

review.reviewBody:
Other reviewers mentioned the same issue. Castelli needed to either make the sleeves wider or at least articulate the elbow. Iâ€™m fairly petite, and the sleeves arenâ€™t terribly restrictive when the jacket is worn over short sleeves. But the sleeve, namely elbow region, become uncomfortable when worn over a long sleeve base layer. Forget wearing a thin fleece jacket underneath.

The body fits true to size, except the shoulders are a bit too narrow. I like the venting that they have on the side body.

This could be OK if you size up and only expect to wear short sleeves underneath.

Returning this because I need a jacket that lets me layer a little, and U donâ€™t like that this jacket is a little noisy.
review.name: Sleeves are too narrow

review.reviewBody: I may have liked this in a large, but ordered a medium (my usual size) and could barely zip it.  May have ripped had I flexed :-).    Returned it.
review.name: Very lightweight, runs very small

review.reviewBody:
The jury is still out on this one; the body is a form fit as described and true to size
But ... the arms are 'super skinny tight' ?? and I have fairly skinny arms! Not sure how they will fit anyone with even 'regular' arms ...
I am going to try on again with a short sleeved bike top and decide on either a return or a keeper.
The 'vest' in the same theme fits like a dream.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: I just got this bag but am so impressed right away that I had to get a review up. First off, I love how it has grab handles all over the entire bag, so it's super easy to grab in any position. Second, the spinner wheels on this bag roll incredibly smoothly!! I love how easy it is to pull around!!! The size is 68L, which is easily enough for 2 people for a weekend or one person who packs a lot or brings bulky items. 1 person packing reasonably light could fit up to 2 weeks worth of clothes. It has 2 zippered main compartments to separate your clothes/gear, a HUGE front pocket that is so much bigger than it looks, its own built-in luggage lock, and another smaller organizing pocket on the interior of the bag. I love this bag and can't wait to take it on a trip! If you have any questions about this bag, feel free to reach out to me at amcclary@backcountry.com or 801-204-4562.
review.name: Initial Impressions

hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Trail Lite Sleeping Pad - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have used this sleeping pad for about a month (Camping) and I love it. A good combination of enough cushioning, but compact and lightweight. The valve is a new version from previous, but it's easy to use and I have had no problems with it.
review.name: I would recommend this product.

review.reviewBody: I've been using this sleeping pad for 2 weeks straight and am very happy with it so far. I replaced my very old sleeping pad with this one and am pleased with how much more compactable and light weight it is. It's definitely on the shorter side, and I find my feet hanging off of the end some times (I'm 5'4""), but part of that is because I put my pillow on top of the pad. If I kept my pillow off the pad I'd fit just fine. I also really like the wings that help deflate the sleeping pad. They're easy to use make the stowing processing much quicker.
review.name: So far so good!

review.reviewBody: It is not light nor the warmest one. But it is the best middle ground. So good that about 80% of my outdoorsy friends are using it. 3 years of extensive use and this thing looks like brand new (I do take proper care of my equipment). Sleep is as comfortable as it gets, I cannot imagine not to have this thing with me. Used in + 30 C temps and all the way to - 7 C - it did it's job perfectly.
review.name: Best all around mat

review.reviewBody: I love how easy to use and lightweight this sleeping pad is! It folds up easily and inflates in just a few breaths. It has quickly become a gear staple for colder weather camping.
review.name: Gear Staple

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. It makes the difference on long trips. It developed a delamination bubble after more than 150 nights of use, but never an air leak. I sent it to the service center and got a new one in the mail 2 weeks later.
review.name: Very confortable

review.reviewBody: So comfy. You can use it anywhere camping, in the back of the car or on a friends floor. I love mine!
review.name: Comfort!

review.reviewBody: I bought this a few years ago and it's still in great condition. This camping air mattress has traveled from the High Peaks in the Adirondacks to NYC. It's never needed a patch and I've always have had a great nights rest. It's really easy to let it self inflate (or add air yourself if you're in a rush). I used this mattress thru hiking the High Peaks in upstate NY it was the middle of November with below 25 degree weather and it worked great. The mattress never lost air or cracked from the cold conditions and it kept me warmer. I know sleeping on the ground can be uncomfortable but it doesn't have to be if you use this air mattress. I have always slept well using this even if the conditions outside aren't so nice.
review.name: Amazing Comfort!!!

review.reviewBody: I bought this matress 6 years ago for a trip to SvÃƒÂ¤llbard, Norway. We had to buy a therm-a-rest because of the aircirculation. It sleeps amazing and has survived all the festivals and campingtrips ever since! I'm so glad, i bought this matress. Because on festivals you really need your sleep and this matress sleeps as my own bed. Nothing but love for my yellow submarine, not only does it sleep like heaven, you roll it up so easy and it is amazingly small.
review.name: Lovely matress

review.reviewBody: I've owned this mattress for about 3 years now and it has proven to provide a comfortable enough sleep on the cold hard ground while tenting. I use a combination of a bivy sack, the thermarest mattress, a self-inflating pillow and of course a sleeping bag when tenting. The bivy sack keeps the mattress and sleeping bag clean and dry... and helps to keep me from shifting too far off the mattress if I'm tossing and turning in my sleep. Keeps the mattress and sleeping bag nicely together. The mattress inflates fairly quick as I keep it inflated, tucked away under the bed when not in use. And it is also pretty easy to deflate and roll away when packing up and heading home. I hope this mattress provides me with many more years of comfort. :-) S.H.
review.name: Happy comfortable camper!

review.reviewBody: My first pad and I'm very happy with it. My husband was so excited about it, he bought a second one for our Boy Scout son to use.
review.name: Perfect length and width

review.reviewBody: This is a horrible jacket it leaked from anywhere there was exposed stitching and then the water crept up and soaked the whole coat in a half hour.
review.name: Not very water tight

review.reviewBody: I didn't keep this for two minor and one major issue. The minor ones: 1) The pockets are top-snap and not very comfortable to put one's hands in, which one usually wants to do in the rainâ€”I wish they were diagonal at least (they also have no drainage holes and are not open to the interior so I assume they'd collect water if actually used); 2) The body is a bit loose compared to the shoulders and sleevesâ€”I got my normal HH size and it was nicely slim up top but baggy below (so I couldn't size down). The major one: The hood is cut way too large without enough structure and sinching it does just that in a very awkward way; I can turn my head without the hood moving with me, which is super annoying if doing anything other than standing thereâ€”if they wanted the top to stick out like a visor, it needs some sort of additional structure and a way to tighten it (for a casual jacket like this, it should just be cut way smaller and not with almost enough space like technical shells that have space for a helmet). I do like the material and the aforementioned fit in the chest and sleeves (including the snaps at the wrist, which tightened it enough for meâ€”but I have small wrists so this might be too snug for most) as well as the rear back vent.
review.name: Some good, more bad

review.reviewBody:
This is the most classic, utilitarian jacket I had in my life. I am 5 11 and I bought size L. It is slightly roomy but you buy this jacket for use not fashion. 
The no nonsense approach of HH is exactly what I admire. It is comfortable and the lining makes it cozy. Highly recommend.
review.name: Amazing and Classic
